description:
If the xenapi plugins do not have execute permissions set, then the plugin is not recognized by XenServer or XCP.
It would be good if we can get the permissions correct in git hub to stop confusing people.
title: xenapi plugins all need the execute permission set

comments.content:
If the xenapi plugins do not have execute permissions set, then the plugin is not recognized by XenServer or XCP.
It would be good if we can get the permissions correct in git hub to stop confusing people.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: turns out only xenhost didn't have the execute bit set, but needed it
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/5330
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: isn't worthwhile catching and logging plugin exceptions too? In case permissions get screwed up for whatever reason (it has happened in the past)?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~armando-migliaccio

comments.content: Not sure we can do much better given what is being reported by XenAPI.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/5330

    Fixes bug 954833
    By adding the execute bit to the xenhost xenapi plugin
